segment.source: This topic describes the reports that are available when you are running Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) in the Stand-alone topology.
segment.target: This topic describes the reports that are available when you are running Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) in the Stand-alone topology.

segment.source: If you are running MBAM with the Configuration Manager Integration topology, you generate reports from Configuration Manager rather than from MBAM.
segment.target: If you are running MBAM with the Configuration Manager Integration topology, you generate reports from Configuration Manager rather than from MBAM.

segment.source: See Viewing MBAM 2.5 Reports for the Configuration Manager Integration Topology for more information about these reports.
segment.target: See Viewing MBAM 2.5 Reports for the Configuration Manager Integration Topology for more information about these reports.

segment.source: Understanding the MBAM Stand-alone topology reports
segment.target: Understanding the MBAM Stand-alone topology reports

segment.source: MBAM provides three report types that you can use to monitor your organization for BitLocker compliance:
segment.target: MBAM provides three report types that you can use to monitor your organization for BitLocker compliance:

segment.source: To access MBAM reports when you are running MBAM in the Stand-alone topology, open a web browser, and then open the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: To access MBAM reports when you are running MBAM in the Stand-alone topology, open a web browser, and then open the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: Select Reports in the left menu bar.
segment.target: Select Reports in the left menu bar.

segment.source: From the top menu bar, select the kind of report that you want to generate.
segment.target: From the top menu bar, select the kind of report that you want to generate.

segment.source: For more information about generating these reports, see Generating MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports.
segment.target: For more information about generating these reports, see Generating MBAM 2.5 Stand-alone Reports.

segment.source: Use this report type to collect information about overall BitLocker compliance in your organization.
segment.target: Use this report type to collect information about overall BitLocker compliance in your organization.

segment.source: You can use filters to narrow your search results to learn more about the compliance state and error status of computers in your organization.
segment.target: You can use filters to narrow your search results to learn more about the compliance state and error status of computers in your organization.

segment.source: Number of computers that MBAM manages.
segment.target: Number of computers that MBAM manages.

segment.source: Percentage of compliant computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: Percentage of compliant computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: Percentage of non-compliant computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: Percentage of non-compliant computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: Percentage of computers exempt from the BitLocker encryption requirement.
segment.target: Percentage of computers exempt from the BitLocker encryption requirement.

segment.source: Percentage of computers not exempt from the BitLocker encryption requirement.
segment.target: Percentage of computers not exempt from the BitLocker encryption requirement.

segment.source: Percentage of compliant computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: Percentage of compliant computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: Percentage of non-compliant computers in the enterprise.
segment.target: Percentage of non-compliant computers in the enterprise.

segment.source: Total computers that are exempt from the BitLocker encryption requirement.
segment.target: Total computers that are exempt from the BitLocker encryption requirement.

segment.source: Total computers that are not exempt from the BitLocker encryption requirement.
segment.target: Total computers that are not exempt from the BitLocker encryption requirement.

segment.source: User-specified DNS name that is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: User-specified DNS name that is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Fully qualified domain name where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Fully qualified domain name where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: State of compliance for the computer, according to the policy specified for the computer.
segment.target: State of compliance for the computer, according to the policy specified for the computer.

segment.source: The states are Noncompliant and Compliant.
segment.target: The states are Noncompliant and Compliant.

segment.source: See the following Enterprise Compliance Report Compliance States table for more information about how to interpret compliance states.
segment.target: See the following Enterprise Compliance Report Compliance States table for more information about how to interpret compliance states.

segment.source: Status that indicates whether this computer is exempt from the BitLocker policy.
segment.target: Status that indicates whether this computer is exempt from the BitLocker policy.

segment.source: Error and status messages about the compliance state of the computer in accordance to the policy specified.
segment.target: Error and status messages about the compliance state of the computer in accordance to the policy specified.

segment.source: Date and time when the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.
segment.target: Date and time when the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.

segment.source: For more information, see the MBAM Group Policy settings.
segment.target: For more information, see the MBAM Group Policy settings.

segment.source: Use this report type to collect information that is specific to a computer or user.
segment.target: Use this report type to collect information that is specific to a computer or user.

segment.source: View this report by clicking the computer name in the Enterprise Compliance Report, or by typing the computer name in the Computer Compliance Report.
segment.target: View this report by clicking the computer name in the Enterprise Compliance Report, or by typing the computer name in the Computer Compliance Report.

segment.source: This report shows detailed encryption information about each drive (operating system and fixed data drives) on a computer.
segment.target: This report shows detailed encryption information about each drive (operating system and fixed data drives) on a computer.

segment.source: It also indicates the policy that is applied to each drive type on the computer.
segment.target: It also indicates the policy that is applied to each drive type on the computer.

segment.source: To view the details of each drive, expand the Computer Name entry.
segment.target: To view the details of each drive, expand the Computer Name entry.

segment.source: Removable Data Volume encryption status is not shown in this report.
segment.target: Removable Data Volume encryption status is not shown in this report.

segment.source: User-specified DNS computer name that is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: User-specified DNS computer name that is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Fully qualified domain name where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Fully qualified domain name where the client computer resides and is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Valid types are Non-Portable and Portable.
segment.target: Valid types are Non-Portable and Portable.

segment.source: Operating system type found on the client computer that is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Operating system type found on the client computer that is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Overall compliance status of the computer that is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Overall compliance status of the computer that is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.
segment.target: Valid states are Compliant and Noncompliant.

segment.source: Notice that the compliance status per drive (see the following table) may indicate different compliance states.
segment.target: Notice that the compliance status per drive (see the following table) may indicate different compliance states.

segment.source: However, this field represents that compliance state, according to the specified policy.
segment.target: However, this field represents that compliance state, according to the specified policy.

segment.source: Cipher strength selected by the administrator during MBAM policy specification (for example, 128-bit with diffuser).
segment.target: Cipher strength selected by the administrator during MBAM policy specification (for example, 128-bit with diffuser).

segment.source: Indicates if encryption is required for the operating system and shows the appropriate protector type.
segment.target: Indicates if encryption is required for the operating system and shows the appropriate protector type.

segment.source: Indicates if encryption is required for the fixed data drive.
segment.target: Indicates if encryption is required for the fixed data drive.

segment.source: Indicates if encryption is required for the removable drive.
segment.target: Indicates if encryption is required for the removable drive.

segment.source: Known users on the computer that is managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Known users on the computer that is managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Status that indicates whether this computer is exempt from the BitLocker policy.
segment.target: Status that indicates whether this computer is exempt from the BitLocker policy.

segment.source: Computer manufacturer name, as it appears in the computer BIOS.
segment.target: Computer manufacturer name, as it appears in the computer BIOS.

segment.source: Computer manufacturer model name, as it appears in the computer BIOS.
segment.target: Computer manufacturer model name, as it appears in the computer BIOS.

segment.source: Error and status messages about the compliance state of the computer, in accordance with the specified policy.
segment.target: Error and status messages about the compliance state of the computer, in accordance with the specified policy.

segment.source: Date and time that the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.
segment.target: Date and time that the computer last contacted the server to report compliance status.

segment.source: For more information, see the MBAM Group Policy settings.
segment.target: For more information, see the MBAM Group Policy settings.

segment.source: Computer drive letter that was assigned to the particular drive by the user.
segment.target: Computer drive letter that was assigned to the particular drive by the user.

segment.source: Valid values are Operating System Drive and Fixed Data Drive.
segment.target: Valid values are Operating System Drive and Fixed Data Drive.

segment.source: These are physical drives rather than logical volumes.
segment.target: These are physical drives rather than logical volumes.

segment.source: Cipher strength selected by the administrator during MBAM policy specification.
segment.target: Cipher strength selected by the administrator during MBAM policy specification.

segment.source: Type of protector selected through the Group Policy setting used to encrypt an operating system or fixed data volume.
segment.target: Type of protector selected through the Group Policy setting used to encrypt an operating system or fixed data volume.

segment.source: Indicates that the computer being managed by MBAM has enabled the protector type that is specified in the policy.
segment.target: Indicates that the computer being managed by MBAM has enabled the protector type that is specified in the policy.

segment.source: The valid states are ON or OFF.
segment.target: The valid states are ON or OFF.

segment.source: Valid states are Encrypted, Not Encrypted, and Encrypting.
segment.target: Valid states are Encrypted, Not Encrypted, and Encrypting.

segment.source: State that indicates whether the drive is in accordance with the policy.
segment.target: State that indicates whether the drive is in accordance with the policy.

segment.source: Error and status messages of the compliance state of the computer, according to the specified policy.
segment.target: Error and status messages of the compliance state of the computer, according to the specified policy.

segment.source: Use this report type to audit users who have requested access to BitLocker recovery keys.
segment.target: Use this report type to audit users who have requested access to BitLocker recovery keys.

segment.source: The report offers several filters based on the desired filtering criteria.
segment.target: The report offers several filters based on the desired filtering criteria.

segment.source: You can filter on a specific type of user (a Help Desk user or an end user), whether the request failed or was successful, the specific type of key requested, and a date range during which the retrieval occurred.
segment.target: You can filter on a specific type of user (a Help Desk user or an end user), whether the request failed or was successful, the specific type of key requested, and a date range during which the retrieval occurred.

segment.source: Date and time that a key retrieval request was made by an end user or Help Desk user.
segment.target: Date and time that a key retrieval request was made by an end user or Help Desk user.

segment.source: The site from which the request was initiated.
segment.target: The site from which the request was initiated.

segment.source: This entry will have one of two values: Self-Service Portal or Helpdesk.
segment.target: This entry will have one of two values: Self-Service Portal or Helpdesk.

segment.source: Valid statuses are Successful (the key was retrieved), or Failed (the key was not retrieved).
segment.target: Valid statuses are Successful (the key was retrieved), or Failed (the key was not retrieved).

segment.source: Help Desk user who initiated the request for key retrieval.
segment.target: Help Desk user who initiated the request for key retrieval.

segment.source: If an Advanced Helpdesk User recovers the key without specifying the end user, the End User field will be blank.
segment.target: If an Advanced Helpdesk User recovers the key without specifying the end user, the End User field will be blank.

segment.source: A standard Helpdesk User must specify the end user, and that user will appear in this field.
segment.target: A standard Helpdesk User must specify the end user, and that user will appear in this field.

segment.source: A recovery via the Self-Service Portal will list the requesting end user both in this field and in the End User field.
segment.target: A recovery via the Self-Service Portal will list the requesting end user both in this field and in the End User field.

segment.source: End user who initiated the request for key retrieval.
segment.target: End user who initiated the request for key retrieval.

segment.source: Computer name of the computer that was recovered.
segment.target: Computer name of the computer that was recovered.

segment.source: Type of key that was requested by the Help Desk user or the end user.
segment.target: Type of key that was requested by the Help Desk user or the end user.

segment.source: The three types of keys that MBAM collects are:
segment.target: The three types of keys that MBAM collects are:

segment.source: Recovery Key Password (used to recover a computer in recovery mode)
segment.target: Recovery Key Password (used to recover a computer in recovery mode)

segment.source: Recovery Key ID (used to recover a computer in recovery mode on behalf of another user)
segment.target: Recovery Key ID (used to recover a computer in recovery mode on behalf of another user)

segment.source: TPM Password Hash (used to recover a computer with a locked TPM)
segment.target: TPM Password Hash (used to recover a computer with a locked TPM)

segment.source: Reason the specified key type was requested by the Help Desk user or the end user.
segment.target: Reason the specified key type was requested by the Help Desk user or the end user.

segment.source: The reasons are specified in the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: The reasons are specified in the Drive Recovery and Manage TPM features of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: The valid entries are user-entered text or one of the following reason codes:
segment.target: The valid entries are user-entered text or one of the following reason codes:

segment.source: Report results can be saved to a file by clicking the Export button on the Reports menu bar.
segment.target: Report results can be saved to a file by clicking the Export button on the Reports menu bar.

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For MBAM issues, use the MBAM TechNet Forum.

segment.source: Monitoring and Reporting BitLocker Compliance with MBAM 2.5
segment.target: Monitoring and Reporting BitLocker Compliance with MBAM 2.5
